en.title: MXC takes the first step towards blockchain integration in Shanghai

post.content:
## MXC takes the first step towards blockchain integration in Shanghai
MXC successfully completed the first step to successful blockchain integration in Shanghai. Since making the groundbreaking announcement of the [Shanghai Yangpu District](https://blog.mxc.org/mxc-government-deal-shanghai/) partnership with the MXC Foundation, the team at MXC worked closely with the district government to bring an efficient and fully integrated smart city data infrastructure to the Yangpu District of Shanghai. This week we completed the first of many tests, ensuring that the hardware is ready for widespread deployment.

Building on a wireless protocol requires reliable wireless connections. One step to ensure that the hardware is up to the MXC Smart City IoT Standard is a range test. Initial Wireless Range Tests “WRT’s” help us identify the number of LPWAN gateways required to cover the entire Yangpu District in Shanghai. As many will know, not all LPWAN sensors are built the same, so to accurately calculate the range and to ensure appropriate calibration for different types of data, a variety of sensors must be tested.

![Sensor](https://cms.mxc.org/uploads/Sensor_940ffdab5f.jpeg)
Sensor used for testing
“As traffic congestion is a major problem in Shanghai, we chose to test car park sensors first,” said Sheen Xin Hu, CEO of the MXC Foundation. “Our initial results are promising, requiring only a few minor modifications before full-scale deployment is ready.”

Testing throughout the district has drawn a wide array of anticipation to the MXProtocol’s blockchain powered smart city wireless infrastructure. Companies and entrepreneurs looking to leverage the network are clambering to get involved in the rollout. Though the project is in the developmental stage, MXC is working to accommodate the early testing requests from these potential partners.

“As the infrastructure takes shape, companies throughout the district have expressed a strong interest in using the MXProtocol enabled wireless infrastructure,” said Aaron Wagener, Co-Founder of the MXC Foundation. “Discussions are ongoing, and our tech team is working to provide them with secure network access so that they can all begin their own testing.”

MXC is creating a sustainable new global data highway using blockchain and a decentralized low power wide area network (LPWAN). Using the MXProtocol, we are creating a long-range, mesh network made up of networks owned by individual companies or government entities. By connecting networks to the MXC ecosystem, the network can be shared, making facilities such as “LPWAN roaming” possible whilst providing an additional source of income for the network owner.

Data collected through an MXProtocol enabled network can be listed in the MXC Data Market, making it compatible with any other system through an API, or a decentralized app (DApp). This data leverages blockchain to ensure the reliability of the data source and in turn the data itself.

Additional tests are scheduled to take place in Shanghai using a wide array of different sensors; including air quality sensors, traffic sensors, and sensors to optimize the emptying of garbage bins.
post.metaDescription: MXC has successfully completed the first step to successful blockchain integration in Shanghai. MXC is building the first blockchain enabled mesh wireless.

post.slug: mxc极域在上海的区块链落地应用迈出了第一步
mxc極域在上海的區塊鏈落地應用邁出了第一步

hans.title: MXC极域在上海的区块链落地应用迈出了第一步

post.content:
MXC极域成功完成了在上海进行区块链落地应用的第一步。 自从宣布了MXC极域基金会与上海杨浦区建立合作伙伴关系的精彩消息，MXC极域团队和区政府有非常密切的合作关系，来带给上海杨浦区有效率和完整的智慧城市数据建设相关之落地应用。本周我们完成了非常多的测试，来确保硬体的部分对大规模的部署是万全准备的。

建立在无线协议上需要可靠的无线连接。 确保硬件符合MXC极域智慧城市物联网标准的第一步是范围测试。 最初的无线范围测试“WRT”可帮助我们确定覆盖整个上海杨浦区的LPWAN闸道器的数量。 众所周知，并不是所有的LPWAN传感器都具有相同的构造，因此要准确计算范围并确保对不同类型的数据进行适当的校准，必须测试各种传感器。


用于测试的传感器
MXC极域基金会CEO胡莘说：“由于交通拥堵是上海市所面临的一个主要问题，我们选择首先测试停车场传感器，” “我们的初步结果是很有希望的，在全面部署准备就绪之前，只需要进行少量的修改即可。”

整个地区的测试结果，使人们对MXC极域协议区块链驱动的智慧城市无线基础设施产生了广泛的期望和关注。 希望利用该网络的公司和企业家纷纷加入到该项目的推广中。 尽管该项目处于开发阶段，但MXC极域仍在努力满足这些潜在合作伙伴的早期测试需求。

![Sensor](https://cms.mxc.org/uploads/Sensor_940ffdab5f.jpeg)

MXC极域基金会联合创始人Aaron Wagener表示：“随着基础设施的不断发展，这块地区的公司们都对使用支持MXC极域协议的无线基础设施表现出了浓厚的兴趣。” “讨论仍在进行中，我们的技术团队正在努力为他们提供安全的网络访问权限，以便他们都可以开始自己的测试。”

MXC极域正在使用区块链和分布式的低功耗广域网（LPWAN）创建可持续的全球数据高速市场。 使用MXC极域协议，我们创建了一个远程的网状网络。该网络由个人、公司、或者政府实体拥有的网络组成。 通过将网络连接到MXC极域生态系统，可以共享网络，从而使诸如“LPWAN漫游”之类的设施成为可能，同时为网络所有者提供额外的收入来源。

通过启用MXC极域协议的网络收集的数据可以在MXC数据市场中列出，从而使其通过API或去中心化应用程序（DApp）与任何其他系统兼容。 该数据利用区块链来确保数据源以及数据本身的可靠性。

计划在上海使用多种不同的传感器进行额外的测试； 包括空气质量传感器，交通传感器以及优化垃圾箱清空的传感器。
post.slug: mxc极域在上海的区块链落地应用迈出了第一步
